quest.name: The Elder's Answer
journal: Wyd Lad looks a satisfied Nu Mou.
Wyd Lad informs you that Elder Wyd Aenc has returned from deliberations and likely has tidings for you. You make your way to the inner cookfire of Pla Enni, where the elder awaits.

Having thanked you for your patronage, Wyd Aenc gives you your answer regarding the stone scepter. Acknowledging that they do not have the power to deal with their fallen monarch, the Nu Mou have decided to entrust the relic to you. Now only the crystal shoes, held in the amaro's safekeeping, remain to be collected. Without further ado, you set out for Wolekdorf to meet with the leader of the amaro, a hulking creature named Seto.

Though Seto receives you warmly, he believes that facing the faerie king is folly, and refuses to give you the crystal shoes. In order to find a way to change Seto's mind, Urianger believes it would behoove you to understand the nature of the amaro of Il Mheg. To that end, he bids you acquaint yourself with the creatures, and recommends giving them a gentle pat by way of a greeting. Scanning the area, your eyes settle on an amaro named Rispa.

Receiving your affectionate gesture with delight, Rispa reminisces about his departed master, a knight of the Kingdom of Voeburt. You learn that the amaro has chosen to remain in Il Mheg, where the kingdom once stood, out of respect for the man's memory. You spare a moment to admire the strength of their bond, then turn your attention to a creature named Eo An.

While not exactly thrilled by your patting, Eo An clarifies that she does not dislike men; on the contrary, amaro were bred to be fond of them. In the beginning, the creatures were mindless beasts, but a mage of Ronka bestowed upon them the gift of intelligence. When the empire fell, those with the gift eventually died out, but some few are still born with the seed of intelligence even now. As you mull over the tale, an amaro named Nimbus catches your eye.

Rather heartwarmingly, Nimbus is overjoyed by your attention. He goes on to explain that he and his fellows have been starved of the company of men ever since they settled in Il Mheg. Confident that you now understand the creatures, you bend your steps back to Urianger.

Urianger affirms your findings that the amaro of Il Mheg bear an intense and abiding love for men, and concludes that it is out of genuine concern for your welfare that Seto sought to prevent your confrontation with the faerie king. Yet confront the faerie king you must, and to that end you must find a way to win the creature's cooperation.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Still offering your patronage to us? When you have a moment, I would speak with you all.

dialogue.name: WYDLAD
dialogue.text: Ahhh, there's nothing like honorable work. Thanks again for giving me the opportunity!

dialogue.name: WYDLAD
dialogue.text: Oh, I should mention that Elder Wyd Aenc returned a moment ago. If you seek them out, I daresay they'll have tidings for you.

dialogue.name: WYDLAD
dialogue.text: Elder Wyd Aenc is at the inner cookfire. If you seek them out, I daresay they'll have tidings for you.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are. I'm informed that you've been an excellent patron to our people. For that, you have my thanks.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Now then, you will be pleased to hear that we've come to a decision regarding the scepter. If you would gather your companions, I will deliver our answer.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Before I begin, please allow me to express my gratitude for your kind patronage.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Having been deprived of purpose for so long, our people are overjoyed at being able to serve again.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: But on to the matter of the stone scepter.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: During our deliberations, we were forced to concede that we will never have the power to deal with our fallen monarch. We can release Titania neither from the castle nor from torment.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: In light of this, we have decided to entrust their fate to you.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Take it─the stone scepter of the Nu Mou.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: This makes three relics. One more and we can arrange a meeting with the Warden.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Ere you continue your quest, allow me to enlighten you as regards your foe.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Know that Titania is not a name, but a title bestowed upon one chosen to lead the pixies by the grace of nature.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: This leader, upon Il Mheg's founding, arose as ruler of all fae folk to bring order to our riotous kind. In our turn, we fae folk render our blessing unto nature─unto water, wood, and wind─that our king might be further empowered.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Though they are become a sin eater, their powers remain unchanged. When you face them, be prepared to face the full fury of nature.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh dear... Is there anything else that we should know?

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Anything else...? Hmmm... Only that if you feel unready for the challenge─and none here would blame you for it─you are welcome to remain among us awhile longer.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: After all, I myself have yet to enjoy your patronage, and who knows when I will next have the chance? We would see that you were comfortable, of course, and do all in our power to make you feel...at home. Eh heh heh...

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Oi!

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Honestly! I look away for one moment, and every faerie and their nuncle tries to steal my sapling from me!

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: This is my sapling! Mine, do you hear!? Not yours and not the Fuath's! And anyone who so much as thinks about trying to seduce herhim will wish they hadn't!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The final relic is a pair of shoes wrought of crystal. They are held in the amaro's safekeeping at their settlement, Wolekdorf.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: It beareth mentioning that these amaro are unlike those which thou hast heretofore encountered. Owing to a peculiarity of evolution, they are capable of speech, and thus we might negotiate with them as we have the fae folk.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Though it saddens us to see you leave, we wish you well on your way.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: When you arrive in Wolekdorf, seek out the largest of the amaro. His name is Seto, and he is their leader and the bearer of the relic.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Oh, you're still here? Do you perhaps wish to remain with us after all...?

dialogue.name: NIMBUS
dialogue.text: Ghrrr... You seek our leader? Continue on past the aetheryte. You cannot miss him.

dialogue.name: TRAVELLER
dialogue.text: Seto? He makes his roost in the next building.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: An enormous amaro slumbers peacefully.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Kal!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Seto!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Mog!

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: Ard...bert?

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: ...Oh. Forgive me, I was...having a dream. Seldom do men visit us. What brings you to our village?

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: Did I hear you aright? You desire the crystal shoes...that you may confront the Lightwarden?

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: No. No, you mustn't think such thoughts.

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: Even if you are indeed immune to the Light's corruption, as you claim, vanquishing the king will bring you naught but sorrow.

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: Forget this folly. Return whence you came.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While we appreciate your concern, we have no choice in the matter. Will you not reconsider?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Come, my friends, let us leave him with his thoughts.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Hmmm... 'Tis harder by far to change the minds of they who mean well than they who mean ill.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Forgive me...but I'm not sure I understand...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: And little wonder. 'Tis the first time thou hast set foot here. 'Twould behoove you all to learn something of the nature of this community, I think, and there is no surer way than to speak with its members.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: In such wise, you will come to understand Seto's reason for refusing us─and, I hope, gain an insight into how he may yet be persuaded...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: So I bid ye seek out the amaro and make yourselves known unto them. A gentle touch shall suffice by way of a greeting.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Despite their seclusion, the amaro here appear to be quite familiar with men.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: They're so fluffy, it's like touching a cloud!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Go, my friend─make thyself known unto the amaro. It requireth no more than a gentle touch.

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: I cannot give you the crystal shoes. Abandon this folly.

dialogue.name: RISPA
dialogue.text: Well now... It is not often that we are visited by men─much less unglamoured ones. What brings you so far from your own kind?

dialogue.name: RISPA
dialogue.text: Khrrr...khrrrrrr... Ah, how long has it been since last I felt man's touch? I cannot help but be reminded of my master's hand...

dialogue.name: RISPA
dialogue.text: He was a knight of Voeburt. A noble and valiant soul.

dialogue.name: RISPA
dialogue.text: But like so many others, he died fighting the sin eaters. Though he is long departed, I remain in this land out of respect for his memory.

dialogue.name: RISPA
dialogue.text: Such a fine feeling it is to be petted. My master had a heavy hand, made heavier still by his gauntlet, but I loved it nonetheless.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: Are you one of those treasure hunters? There is nothing left for you here.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: What are you doing? I do not understand...

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: Agh! Th-That tickles! Enough! I never had a master─I'm not accustomed to it!

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: Not that I dislike your kind, you understand. On the contrary, we amaro were bred to be fond of men.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: In the beginning, we were all of us mindless beasts. But then a mage of Ronka gave us the gift of intelligence, that we might better serve our masters.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: After that empire fell, those with the gift eventually died out. On rare occasions, however, we are born with the seed of our ancestors in us.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: If we live long enough amongst men, this seed may quicken, restoring the power of speech to us amongst other things. So it was with me...though I never had a master, as I told you.

dialogue.name: EOAN
dialogue.text: But I will not bore you with my sorry tale. Let it suffice to say that I am no stranger to abandonment.

dialogue.name: NIMBUS
dialogue.text: What is all the commotion? Did something happen while we slumbered?

dialogue.name: NIMBUS
dialogue.text: Ghrrr...

dialogue.name: NIMBUS
dialogue.text: Ghrrr!? What's happening!? Why am I being patted!? It's...it's wonderful...

dialogue.name: NIMBUS
dialogue.text: Seldom do we have the chance to enjoy the attentions of men. Your kind are loath to come here for fear of the fae folk.

dialogue.name: NIMBUS
dialogue.text: ...But then we are fae folk too. When first we made our home here, we swore an oath to the faerie king, you see. 'Tis easy to forget sometimes.

dialogue.name: NIMBUS
dialogue.text: Ghrrr... You may pat me whenever you wish, and for as long as you like. My plumage is very resilient!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thou hast peered into the hearts of the amaro, I take it?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Then thou canst not choose but see the intense and abiding love they bear for men. It is out of concern for our welfare, and not scorn, that Seto seeketh to dissuade us from confronting their king.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Yet confront their king we must, and to that end we must needs have the crystal shoes...
